http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Contents: Part I. Mathematical and physical underpinnings of spacetime: Figures of light in the early history of relativity (1905-1914) / Scott A. Walter -- The behaviour of rods and clocks in general relativity and the meaning of the metric field / Harvey R. Brown -- Hilbert on general covariance and causality / Katherine Brading and Thomas Ryckman -- Part II. Testing general relativity and rival theories: Putting general relativity to the test : twentieth-century highlights and twenty-first century prospects / Clifford M. Will -- Rotating hollow and full spheres : Einstein, Thirring, Lense, and beyond / Herbert Pfister -- Relativistic lighthouses : the role of the binary pulsar in proving the existence of gravitational waves / Daniel Kennefick -- The rise and fall of the fifth force / Allan Franklin -- Part III: Geometry and cosmology, past and present: Cyclic models of the relativistic universe : the early history / Helge Kragh -- Inflation and the origins of structure / Chris Smeenk -- Problems with modified theories of gravity, as alternatives to dark energy / Norbert Straumann -- The unexpected resurgence of Weyl geometry in late 20th-century physics / Erhard Scholz -- Part IV. Mathematical motifs in general relativity and beyond: Matter from space / Domenico Giulini -- The surprising resolution of the Poincaré conjecture / Donal O'Shea -- Unified field theory up to the 1960s : its development and some interactions among research groups / Hubert Goenner -- Part V. Quantum gravity, conformal boundaries, and string theory: The formulation of quantum field theory in curved spacetime / Robert M. Wald -- Conformal infinity : development and applications / Jörg Fraudendiener -- String theory and spacetime geometry / Matthias R. Gaberdiel -- Conference program / Volker Bach and David E. Rowe.
